file_summary: This `docker-compose.yml` file defines and configures two database services, MySQL and PostgreSQL, intended for local development environments, likely for an application like Spring PetClinic given the database names. The MySQL service uses `mysql:9.2`, maps port 3306, sets up an empty root password, and defines `petclinic` as the user, password, and database. It also mounts a `conf.d` directory for custom MySQL configurations. The PostgreSQL service uses `postgres:17.5`, maps port 5432, and similarly defines `petclinic` as the user, password, and database. This setup allows developers to easily spin up required database instances without manual installation, facilitating consistent development environments.
attributes: services: object (top-level definition for all services)
image: string (Docker image name for a service)
ports: array (port mappings for a service)
environment: map (environment variables for a service)
volumes: array (volume mounts for a service)
